snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, heading to Washington for a three-day visit, will add his voice to President Obama’s in discouraging an Israeli military strike on Iran, a diplomat said.
abstract: British officials say Prime Min David Cameron will add his voice to Pres Obama's in discouraging an Israeli military strike on Iran when he arrives in the United States for a three-day visit.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JOHN F. BURNS
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington and John F. Burns from London.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, heading to Washington for a three-day visit, will add his voice to President Obama’s in discouraging an Israeli military strike on Iran, a diplomat said.

headline.seo: Britain to Join Obama in Discouraging Israeli Strike on Iran
headline.main: Britain to Join Obama in Discouraging a Strike on Iran
headline.print_headline: Britain to Join Obama in Discouraging a Strike on Iran
